title: Senior Java Architect
description: SAVE JOB Senior Java Architect | Colombo Location:  Colombo  Salary:  USD 3,000 – 4,000 per month (based on experience and performance)   Type:  Full-time Job Responsibilities System Architecture Design and Optimization Design and continuously optimize scalable, maintainable, and high-availability systems based on the Java technology stack, aligned with business growth needs. Technology Selection and Solution Design Lead the selection of core technologies and formulate feasible, high-quality technical solutions, including microservices, middleware, and enterprise-level architecture. Microservices and Distributed Systems Build and maintain microservices architecture using frameworks like Spring Cloud or Apache Dubbo, promoting service decoupling, modularization, and scalability. High Concurrency and Performance Tuning Demonstrate strong expertise in JVM tuning, multithreading, and concurrent programming; conduct in-depth analysis and optimization for large-scale, high-concurrency systems. Code Quality and Technical Review Establish coding standards and enforce best practices; participate in code and architecture reviews to ensure high-quality and maintainable codebases. Technical Problem Solving Take ownership of solving complex technical issues such as distributed transactions, cache consistency, and message reliability in production environments. Middleware and Infrastructure Support Provide deep technical understanding and implementation guidance for commonly used middleware such as Redis, Kafka, MySQL, MongoDB, Elasticsearch, and RabbitMQ. Team Technical Leadership and Mentorship Guide and mentor junior and mid-level developers; organize technical training and knowledge sharing to improve overall team capabilities. Research and Innovation Keep up with trends in the Java ecosystem (e.g., Spring Boot 3.x, containerization, Kubernetes, Serverless), and evaluate their potential application in real-world business scenarios. Job Requirements Education & Experience Bachelor’s degree or above in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. 7+ years of Java development experience, with at least 2 years in an architectural or technical leadership role. Technical Skills Proficient in Java and core frameworks such as Spring Boot, Spring Cloud, Hibernate, and MyBatis. Solid understanding of microservices architecture, distributed systems, and service governance. Experience with databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL), caching systems (e.g., Redis), and messaging middleware (e.g., Kafka, RabbitMQ). Familiar with DevOps tools and processes (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Git). Strong knowledge of system performance tuning, JVM optimization, and troubleshooting. Architecture & Design Deep understanding of system design principles, design patterns, and scalability best practices. Experience in designing high-concurrency, high-availability, and fault-tolerant systems. Ability to conduct architecture reviews and technical risk assessments. Soft Skills Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and documentation skills. Leadership and mentorship ability, with experience guiding development teams. Self-driven, proactive, and capable of working independently or as part of a team. Preferred Qualifications (optional) Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Alibaba Cloud. Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and observability tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, ELK). Open-source contributions or active involvement in the Java community is a plus. title: Data Analyst
description: SAVE JOB Data Analyst Job Purpose:  Responsible for importing, processing, analyzing, modeling, and presenting data for future opportunities and improvements. Deliver analytics, dashboards, or reports for strategic decision-making purposes and manage operational data requests from relevant Business Units. Systematically gather and appraise relevant data, including numerical, verbal, and other sources of information. Mine data from primary and secondary sources, then reorganize them in a format that can be easily read by either human or machine. The Job: Synthesize research findings in easy-to-understand terms for the business. Apply simple problem-solving methodologies to diagnose and solve operational and interpersonal problems. Recommend resource requirements and collaborate with relevant stakeholders. Provide business metrics for the overall project to show improvements. Implement enhancements and fixes to systems as needed. Provide ongoing tracking and monitoring of performance of decision systems and statistical models. Communicate and work with business subject matter experts. Lead initiatives for continual improvements. Design experiments as required to try out use cases. Define performance tracking metrics including (but not limited to) incremental takeup, revenue, etc. Retrain/periodic revision of model performance. Measure impact/ROI and identify further optimization. Provide guidance to achieve consistent commercial growth and execution excellence in the division/BU. Execute campaigns with functional units and measure the effectiveness of campaigns. Influence stakeholders for driving new projects and campaigns. Conduct in-house consultative meetings with internal stakeholders for insights sharing and get feedback to improve special campaigns. Conduct continuous assessments of adoption programs and set clear objectives and report performances. Manage operational report requests via Tableau/Safe Harbor. Attend development of Analytics at the EDGE project. Work with business/support units to identify opportunities for leveraging organization's data to drive business. Collect data from internal & external sources. Clean and prepare data as suitable for analytical tasks. Carry out exploratory data analysis, visualization, hypothesis testing. Present findings & actionable intelligence to stakeholders & senior management through data visualization tools. Define activities, strategic direction, scope, and timelines on data science projects. Develop dashboards to cater to divisional business requirements. Work in cross-functional teams (internal & external) to develop & trial use cases. Carry out data preparation, cleansing, exploratory analysis, feature engineering at scale. Maintain documentation of methodology, source codes, version control & other best practices in development operations. Adhere to agile development practices. Write reports and deliver presentations to all levels of colleagues and peer groups in ways that support the business. Conduct both quantitative and qualitative analysis. Research on industry best practices and work with internal/external parties on RnD tasks. Prepare roadmaps, investment papers, and research on emerging technologies. Communicate and work with business subject matter experts for continuous improvement of methodologies. Carry out trials, adaptations of methodologies. Knowledge sharing and collaboration building. Acquire certifications offered through MOOC. Ensure Predictive models are live and automated within the key business processes. Training & Certification on SQL, Python OR R & other necessary tools to become a subject matter expert. Groom Edge Users on SQL/Tableau & empower on self-extractions. Data Quality Management & Data Cleansing for the Data relevant for the Division. The Person: BSc in IT/Computer Science/AI/Data Science/Statistics, Software Engineering, Economics, and Business. Should score 70% above from entry-level exam. Passionate about creating value through scientific methods and data analysis. Axiata Fast-forward Training. Tolerance for ambiguity and openness to feedback from design, strategy, and other disciplines. PLEASE CLICK THE APPLY BUTTON TO SEND YOUR CV VIA XPRESSJOBS

title: Urgent Manager – Travel Agency
company: Ezulwini, Eswatini Urgent Seylan travel and tours Foreign Job, Island Wide URGENT
description: SAVE JOB Manager – Travel Agency | Ezulwini, Eswatini Seylan Travel and Tours (Pty) Ltd, a leading travel services provider based in Ezulwini, Eswatini, is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Travel Agency Manager to join our growing team. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced travel professional to lead operations, manage staff, and drive the delivery of exceptional travel services. Minimum Qualifications & Experience Fully IATA-qualified (essential). A minimum of five (5) years’ experience in airline ticketing. Proficient in Galileo to Travelport reservation systems. Prior experience in managing travel operations or a senior travel consultant role is an added advantage. Key Responsibilities Lead and manage a team of Travel Consultants, ensuring high service standards and operational efficiency. Oversee the day-to-day operations of the travel office. Manage and coordinate local, regional, and international tours, including: Airline ticketing. Hotel bookings. Holiday package planning. Travel itinerary preparation. Ensure exceptional customer service delivery and the ability to engage with clients of diverse backgrounds. Maintain strong relationships with airlines, hotels, and other travel partners. Drive sales targets and support business growth initiatives. Ideal Candidate Profile Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills. Strong leadership and team management ability. Highly organized with strong attention to detail. Able to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment. Willing and able to relocate to Ezulwini, Eswatini. What We Offer Company-provided housing. Company car. Attractive and competitive salary package. Supportive work environment in a rapidly expanding travel business. PLEASE CLICK THE APPLY BUTTON TO SEND YOUR CV VIA XPRESSJOBS

title: Deputy Manager - al Audit
company: Deputy Manager - al Audit Nations Trust Bank
description: SAVE JOB Deputy Manager - Internal Audit Job Profile Perform audits of Departments, Branches and other operational units to ensure compliance with established procedures, identify and mitigate potential risks, and verify that internal controls are consistently applied across all operational activities. Continuously update audit programs to integrate new bank instructions, regulations, directions, and key controls. Aim for ongoing improvement in the risk environment, including information security risk, by implementing effective controls to minimize operational and other losses for the bank. Utilize data analytics to craft compelling audit observations that underscore implications and offer practical, cost-effective recommendations for corrective actions and qualitative enhancements, ensuring timely delivery. Conduct support tasks in testing key controls and share observations within the specified deadlines. Conduct/ support internal investigations assigned and submit findings to the AVP/ CIA Review procedure manuals and ensure all relevant risks have been identified and suitable & cost effective mitigants are incorporated. Collaborate with all levels of management and staff to ensure that risks identified during audits are effectively addressed and managed. Act as an ambassador for the Internal Audit Department, partnering the auditee to offer valuable insight & guidance to resolve identified issues. Special Skills Overall knowledge of Branch Banking and operational knowledge of various Retail and Corporate Banking products / Operations. Analytical skills to evaluate procedures and identify risks & suggest / implement suitable and practical mitigants. Excellent Communication and report writing skills, with the ability to detail findings in a methodical, logical and concise manner. Ability to execute assigned tasks with minimum supervision and within the stipulated timeframe. A flair for data analytics. Experience & Qualifications Experience & Qualifications Five years’ experience in a Bank / Financial Institution with experience in Branch banking, and/or Banking operations related areas.  Previous experience in internal/external auditing would be a distinct advantage OR Four years’ experience in a Bank /Financial Institution with experience in Branch banking, and/or Banking operations related areas.  A part qualification in Banking (Completion of Certificate level of Banking Examination - CBF) or CIMA/CIM/ACCA/ACA (completion of the 2nd stage) Or completion of 2 years of a 3-year Degree Programme Previous experience in internal/external auditing would be a distinct advantage. PLEASE CLICK THE APPLY BUTTON TO SEND YOUR CV VIA XPRESSJOBS

title: Senior Executive – Factory Procurement
description: SAVE JOB Position:  Senior Executive – Factory Procurement Position Snapshot: Place of work:  Nestlé Lanka Kurunegala Factory Area : Procurement Position Summary: The candidate is responsible for the sourcing of imported MRP and Non‑MRP OPEX materials and Technical Services while ensuring compliance with Nestlé Procurement standards. The role involves coordinating with internal teams and overseas suppliers to secure timely material delivery, optimize freight solutions, meet import regulations, and continuously improve the end‑to‑end Source to Pay process. A day in the life of the role: Ensure on‑time delivery of import materials according to business needs and service levels. Drive the end‑to‑end P2P (E2E) process for assigned categories and ensure SLAs are fully met. Select and recommend freight vendors, ensuring efficient shipment delivery to the factory gate. Coordinate with the Shipping Desk and relevant teams to ensure smooth customs clearance. Ensure timely payments to overseas vendors in line with national regulations. Identify and drive cost‑saving opportunities, constructively challenging the status quo. Reduce single‑vendor dependency and identify alternative suppliers to enhance competitiveness. Maintain strong relationships with key internal stakeholders to support operational requirements. Support NCE, FI initiatives, CI projects, and contribute to sustainable operational excellence. Follow up and close out actions related to Procurement audit gaps. What will make you successful? Education: A degree in Supply Chain Management, Business or any related field Expected experience: minimum 2 years of experience in the areas of Procurement/ Supply Chain or in similar capacity. Language skills: Fluency in English and Sinhala Other skills: Strong service‑oriented mindset with excellent stakeholder management, communication, and interpersonal skills. Be proactive and results‑driven with strong analytical and innovative thinking. Able to collaborate effectively across teams in a dynamic environment. Join our Nestlé family at the state‑of‑the‑art Kurunegala Factory in Pannala, where you’ll enjoy a competitive rewards package, exciting perks, meaningful learning and development opportunities, and a supportive, inclusive workplace designed to help you thrive. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity provider. Please click the ' Apply' button to send your CV via XpressJobs  #nestleJobs #Nestlé  View Job Ad

title: Regional – Manager Workforce Management
description: SAVE JOB Regional – Manager Workforce Management  We are seeking a strategic and results-driven Regional Workforce Manager to lead  Workforce Management (WFM) and Business Intelligence (BI) functions across five  ventures. This leadership role demands strong expertise in forecasting, planning, scheduling, business planning, and project management, with a focus on optimizing workforce performance and enabling operational excellence. The ideal candidate will manage a high performing team of 8 professionals, driving data-driven decisions and supporting cross functional initiatives at a regional level.  Key Responsibilities: Workforce Management & Operations: Develop and execute long-term and short-term workforce strategies across five ventures. Lead WFM functions including forecasting, capacity planning, scheduling, real-time management, and staffing optimization. Ensure staffing alignment with business targets and service level agreements (SLAs). Business Planning & Forecasting: Collaborate with Finance, Operations, and HR to integrate headcount plans with business objectives. Own monthly, quarterly, and annual forecasting cycles, presenting labor cost and FTE models to leadership. Drive scenario modelling and “what-if” analysis for new initiatives and growth Project & Program Management: Lead and manage cross-venture strategic workforce projects from initiation to delivery. Standardize and improve WFM processes and tools across ventures. Identify and manage risks, dependencies, and resource constraints. Data & Business Intelligence: Leverage BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Excel) to generate actionable workforce insights. Define KPIs and dashboards to monitor and improve workforce efficiency. Collaborate with data teams to ensure data integrity and scalability of reporting. Leadership & People Management: Manage and mentor a team of 8 WFM and BI professionals. Foster a high-performance culture, encourage professional development, and drive team engagement. Set clear performance expectations and conduct regular feedback and performance reviews. Requirements : Education & Experience: Bachelor's degree in Business, Operations, Mathematics, or related field (Master's preferred). 7+ years of experience in Workforce Management, with at least 3 years in a leadership role. Proven experience managing multi-venture or regional operations. Skills & Competencies: Strong analytical, problem-solving, and quantitative skills. Proficiency in WFM tools (e.g., Verint, NICE, Aspect) and BI platforms (e.g., Power BI, Tableau). Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills. Ability to lead cross-functional teams and influence without authority. Project management certification (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2) is a plus. Key Attributes: Strategic thinker with hands-on execution capability. Adaptable and resilient in a fast-paced environment. Strong leadership presence and decision-making capability. Job Description Monthly/ annual planning of User Incentive budget. Set UI department KPIs (guided Orders & GMV, Discounts & efficiency) targets. Monthly planning of discounts and promotions. Monitoring and tracking UI performance. Conduct analysis on user behavior & utilization of discounts to optimize spends. Collaborate & coordinate with Finance team to align on plans and budgets based on overall strategy. Job Requirements Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Economics, Marketing, or a related field. Above eight years of experience in user incentives strategy, preferably in the e-commerce or tech industry, with a proven track record of success. In-depth understanding of customer, acquisition retention, and loyalty strategies, with a focus on user incentives. Strong analytical skills, with the ability to interpret data and make strategic decisions based on insights. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, capable of building effective relationships with stakeholders and leading a team. Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks, and deliver results in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. title: Senior Executive - Procurement (Raw Materials)
description: SAVE JOB Senior Executive - Procurement (Raw Materials) | Horana Location:  Harumi Holdings (Pvt) Ltd - (Horana) Who are we Dreamron Group of companies is in the business of manufacturing and marketing a wide range of quality Professional Cosmetics, Hair Care, Skin Care, Toiletries products and making inroads into Perfume market to extend its product portfolio for more aggressive growth. It's 120,000 sqft manufacturing facility and office complex is located in a 10 acre land with two plants certified by GMP, ISO 9001-2015 - one plant is dedicated to exports with BOI approval and another for local brand manufacturing and 3rd party contract manufacturing. The group has 4 business entities namely; Kindai Kagaku Lanka (Pvt) Ltd, Harumi Holdings (Pvt) Ltd, Dreamron Lanka (Pvt) Ltd and Dreamron College of Art and Beauty. The group employees over 650 people. Currently Dreamron products are marketed in over 20 countries and the group is specialized in manufacturing OEM brands and Private labels for several leading global cosmetic and toiletries brands. Dreamron has a very dominant market position in the local professional Cosmetic market with a wide range of solutions. Job Summary The Senior Executive - Procurement (Raw Materials) will serve as a strategic pillar in ensuring the seamless and compliant supply of high-quality raw materials critical for cosmetic manufacturing. This role requires advanced technical expertise in cosmetic ingredients, regulatory standards, and global sourcing practices. The incumbent will develop and execute procurement strategies, evaluate suppliers based on quality, cost, sustainability, and reliability, and ensure alignment with production and product development schedules. Strong collaboration with R&D, QA, Production, and Logistics teams is essential to mitigate supply chain risks, implement efficient procurement processes, and maintain laboratory and regulatory compliance. The role also involves leveraging data-driven insights to monitor market trends, identify innovative sourcing solutions, and optimize supplier performance to drive continuous improvement. Key Accountabilities Strategically manage local and international raw material procurement in line with production forecasts, lead times, and uninterrupted supply. Evaluate, negotiate, and engage with suppliers to secure optimal quality, cost, and delivery performance. Raise and manage Purchase Orders (POs) and ensure timely material receipt and documentation compliance. Maintain robust coordination with Laboratory, Production, QA, Warehouse, Finance, and Logistics teams to prevent supply disruptions. Ensure all raw materials comply with laboratory specifications, MSDS, COA, GMP, and cosmetic regulatory standards. Maintain a LAB-approved supplier database and continuously monitor supplier performance metrics. Coordinate import documentation and compliance with the Logistics Department and external partners. Proactively identify and mitigate supply risks, delays, and quality-related issues. Maintain procurement records, generate analytical reports, and provide insights for strategic decision-making.  Required Qualifications BSc in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Pharmaceutical Sciences, Industrial Chemistry, or a closely related scientific discipline Strong command of English (written and spoken) with excellent negotiation and interpersonal skills. Advanced Diploma or professional qualification in Procurement, Supply Chain, or Logistics is an advantage. Advanced knowledge of procurement processes, supplier management, and inventory control. Proficiency in MS Office and ERP systems (mandatory). 2-3 years of similar level experience in raw material procurement within the cosmetic, pharmaceutical, or related manufacturing industry. Proven track record in supplier evaluation, negotiation, and international sourcing. Experience in working closely with cross-functional teams (R&D, QA, Production, Logistics) is highly preferred. Work Location Poruwadanda, Horana. Preference for candidates residing nearby for seamless operational collaboration. Why Join Us? Competitive salary and benefit package Opportunities for professional development and certification A collaborative and safety-focused work environment PLEASE CLICK THE APPLY BUTTON TO SEND YOUR CV VIA XPRESSJOBS View Job Ad

title: Software Architect
description: SAVE JOB Software Architect | Colombo  Location - COLOMBO Experience - 8 + years About the Organization Our Client is a premier in the field of Information Technology providing best technology solutions for the global travel and aviation industry since 2005.They offer a wide range of tailor-made aviation technology solutions which cater to every aspect of the organization. first and largest low-cost carrier in the Middle East & Africa. They are headquartered in Sharjah –UAE, while the Research and Development center is located in Colombo, Sri Lanka since November 2010. Key Result Responsibilities: Provide technology expertise and contributes to the management of technology life cycle. Investigates and analyses application architecture, technology stack, design, development, deployment and automated testing. In collaboration with product team, project managers, and IT solutions managers, translates business needs into technical requirements and recommends cost-effective solutions/alternatives in line with the architectural principles laid down for ISA products. Manages testing and implementation of technical solutions; reviews technical documentation- user guides, training manuals, and system specifications ensuring adequacy from a knowledge management and compliance with customer expectations perspectives. Reviews specifications and information of the architectural design to create the product backlog , identify additional requirements, and highlight gaps (if any); recommends additional requirements to the Product Team as needed. Identifies and decides on the technical tools and languages needed for the design execution in line with the adopted technical and quality standards. Establishes/enforces efficient continuous delivery and production operations processes; creates deployment architecture based on open source technology stack for automation. Ensures the User Interfaces used for the product are in line with requirements and rightly implemented Conducts market researches to keep up with, identify, and implement best practices, new trends, and emerging technologies that bring best value to ISA clients; partners with cross-functional teams to explore ways and means to adopt/monitor such technologies. Assists in the evaluation of external vendors and products and provides input to business managers on business cases. Co-manages the implementation of agreed remedies and preventative measures. Ensures compliance of the implementation with the architecture. Assists ISA teams to ensure agreed service levels are met; provides needed status reports to specialists, users and managers. Assists in the identification and assessment of potential risks to technology infrastructure and their impact on the business; anticipates, identifies and resolves issues relating to client facing architecture and assists in developing mitigation and backup plans. Installs and maintains security patches in production and non-production environments and provides technical governance and sign off on engineering team deliverables. Leads and guides other technology experts internally; ensures there is proper, sufficient and continuous knowledge sharing within ISA. Cultivates and maintains effective working relationships with a variety of stakeholders, including project managers, product, operations, governance and enterprise development teams. Initiates and Influences thinking and decision-making with respect to technology to the best of ISA. Performs any additional duties as directed by the line manager. Work Experience / Other Competencies Minimum 8 years in IT Infrastructure design and management out of which at least 2 years in a “Software Architect” position responsible for managing infrastructure operations and application support. DevOps principles and stages of CICD process from source code management, to build, deployment and test automation, finishing with production deployment Proven skills in Java, J2ee, Oracle database, Spring, Hibernate, Struts 2, jQuery, JavaScript, JBOSS & tomcat as application servers, unit testing, etc Hands-on designing solutions for IaaS, PaaS and SaaS based set-ups, managing vendors and service providers. Experienced in core system configuration and systems testing. Holistic IT Knowledge of heterogeneous technology environments - experienced with different types of end-to-end technology stacks. Skilled in networking concepts: Routing, Web Application Firewalls, Load Balancing & VPC in a cloud environment. Hands-on production operations and site reliability engineering principles; Capable of conducting cost-benefit analysis for IT investments. Hands on technical leadership, technical solution design, and architecture. Proven skills in analyzing data, identifying pitfalls and recommending cost-effective solutions. Cost-oriented, possesses effective persuasive, negotiation, problem solving and decision-making skills. Employs technical interpersonal skills to achieve company’s objectives. Demonstrates the ability to contribute and deliver against business strategy and set KPIs. PLEASE CLICK THE APPLY BUTTON TO SEND YOUR CV VIA XPRESSJOBS

title: Head of AI
description: SAVE JOB Company Overview: Established in 2011, Omobio (Private) Limited is a leading Telecom Software Solutions provider and a fast-growing company in Sri Lanka, catering to local andforeign telecommunication companies and service providers. We are a technology-centric company built on a culture of brilliance, humility and trust. We build products that we’re incredibly proud of; for clients that we deeply respect; all within a team with a great culture and colleagues. You will always have someone next to you helping you take on the next big challenge and we will support you in delivering the most creative and solutions possible. Role Overview: As the Head of AI, you will lead the AI strategy, research, and implementation ofcutting-edge AI/ML solutions to enhance our products and services. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI-driven insights, automation, and intelligence into our applications. This role requires a mix of technical expertise, leadership skills, and strategic vision to position the company at the forefront of AI innovation.   Key Responsibilities: Develop and execute AI strategy aligned with business objectives across telecommunications, mobile self-care, healthcare, and web applications. Lead AI research and innovation to implement advanced machine learning (ML), deep learning (DL), natural language processing (NLP), and generative AI technologies. Collaborate with product, engineering, and business teams to identify AI- driven opportunities for automation, customer experience, and operational efficiency. Architect and oversee AI solutions, ensuring scalability, security, and compliance with industry standards. Lead, mentor, and expand the AI team, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous learning. Stay ahead of AI trends, tools, and technologies to keep the company competitive in AI-driven applications. Ensure ethical AI practices and responsible AI deployment across all products. Develop partnerships with universities, research institutions, and AI communities to drive knowledge sharing and innovation. Monitor AI performance metrics and optimize models for accuracy, efficiency, and real-world applicability. Required Qualifications & Experience: Bachelor’s/Master’s/PhD in Computer Science, AI, Data Science, or a related field. 05+ years of experience in AI/ML development, with at least 2-3 years in a leadership role. Proven experience in deploying AI-driven solutions in telecommunications, healthcare, or web applications. Expertise in AI technologies such as machine learning, deep learning, NLP, computer vision, generative AI, and AI-powered automation. Strong knowledge of AI frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, OpenAI, etc.) and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). Experience with big data processing, MLOps, and AI ethics. Strong leadership, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. Ability to communicate AI concepts effectively to technical and non-technical stakeholders Experience in AI-driven automation in the telecom industry (e.g., predictive maintenance, chatbot solutions, network optimization). Knowledge of AI applications in healthcare, including medical image processing, predictive analytics, and AI-assisted diagnostics. Experience in large-scale AI deployments and optimization. Why Join Us? Opportunity to lead AI innovation in a company that operates across diverse industries. Work on cutting-edge AI solutions with a direct impact on telecommunications, mobile self-care, healthcare, and beyond. A collaborative and innovative culture that encourages research and development. Competitive salary, benefits, and growth opportunities. PLEASE CLICK THE APPLY BUTTON TO SEND YOUR CV VIA XPRESSJOBS

title: Intern / Associate - Sales & Marketing
description: SAVE JOB Intern / Associate -  Sales & Marketing | Colombo 8 About Xentura ONE  Xentura One (Pvt) Limited is a cloud-first solutions company and Microsoft Solutions Partner, helping organizations modernize workplaces, secure environments, and optimize licensing. Our service lines include Modern Workplace, Cyber Security, Microsoft Licensing, Modern Cloud, Process Automation, and Managed Services. We operate from Colombo 08, Sri Lanka with regional presence in Singapore and the UAE. Our partner ecosystem spans Microsoft plus other global technology providers (e.g., Huawei Cloud, Google Cloud, Sophos) to deliver complete cloud outcomes for customers.  Role Overview You will help generate pipeline, shape proposals, coordinate distributer/vendor quotes, activate orders, and run light‑weight campaigns that move opportunities to close—primarily across Microsoft 365, Dynamics 365, Azure‑adjacent services, and managed support. You’ll collaborate daily with Account Managers and Product Managers, and communicate with distributors/partners to obtain pricing and align on order execution.  What You’ll Do (Key Responsibilities) Sales Execution Qualify inbound leads and prospect targeted accounts; book discovery calls and demos. Build proposals and quotations; request and reconcile distributor quotes and pro‑rated pricing; maintain price files and term sheets.  Prepare customer‑ready emails and documents; follow up on POs, order confirmations, and billing status; coordinate license activation/changes (monthly/annual, NCE terms).  Support account handovers and internal escalations; keep stakeholders updated.  Marketing Support Execute light‑weight campaigns (email, social posts, webinars) that align to service pillars—Modern Workplace, Security, Licensing, Cloud, Automation, Managed Services.  Draft case snippets and one‑pagers from won deals; maintain content in shared repositories. Produce weekly pipeline snapshots and campaign metrics; assist with QBR inputs. Success Looks Like (30/60/90 Days) 30 Days: Ramp on offerings, pricing models, and proposal templates; complete shadowing on 5–8 opportunities; independently prepare 2–3 price requests/quotes with supervision. 60 Days: Own a small book of SMB opportunities; deliver at least one micro‑campaign aligned to a service pillar; hit SLA for quote turnarounds. 90 Days: Manage 8–12 opportunities end‑to‑end with minimal oversight; contribute a published customer win story; support one quarterly renewal motion.  Qualifications Must‑Have (Intern & Associate) Clear, concise written and verbal communication (English; Sinhala/Tamil a plus). Strong organization and follow‑through across multiple stakeholders and deadlines. Proficiency with Microsoft 365 apps (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Teams). Curiosity about cloud technology and a commercial mindset. Nice‑to‑Have Familiarity with Microsoft 365 / Dynamics 365 licensing concepts (SKUs, NCE, monthly vs. annual, pro‑rating) and basic cloud/security terminology.  Exposure to CRM tools and email marketing platforms. Prior internship or extracurricular experience in sales, marketing, or tech communities. Education Intern: Undergraduate in Business, Marketing, IT/IS, or related field (or equivalent skills). Associate: Bachelor’s degree preferred; 0–2 years of relevant experience (internships count). Role Levels & Compensation Intern — Sales & Marketing Duration: [3–6 months] · Stipend: [LKR 15,000-30,000 / month] · Work model: [On‑site/Hybrid] Focus on learning core processes, building outreach, and assisting with proposals/quotes. title: Product Manager, AI Innovation (Ekwa Labs)
company: Work from Home Bizycorp (Private) Ltd Work From Home
description: SAVE JOB Product Manager, AI Innovation (Ekwa Labs) | Work from Home We're on a mission to transform healthcare operations through AI-powered solutions. Our focus spans dental practices, aesthetic clinics, and broader healthcare markets. We're a fully remote, globally distributed team moving fast and experimenting boldly.  If you're energized by building products from zero to market launch in a fast-paced, high-impact environment, we'd love to hear from you. About the Role: We're looking for a Product Manager to own the end-to-end lifecycle of AI products within Ekwa Labs. You'll be responsible for taking products from initial research and ideation through prototype development, client testing, and full market launch.  Job Responsibilities: Own product strategy, roadmap, and execution for AI-powered solutions within the Ekwa Labs portfolio. Conduct rapid feasibility assessments and market research to validate new product opportunities in healthcare and dental markets. Lead the full product development cycle: from prototype to testing to early client validation to market launch. Partner with engineering and design teams to translate customer problems into intuitive, scalable product solutions. Manage founding and early client programs—recruiting participants, gathering feedback, iterating based on real-world usage, and ensuring exceptional client experiences. Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success to ensure successful go-to-market execution. Define success metrics, monitor product performance, and use data to drive continuous improvement and iteration. Stay ahead of AI trends and healthcare industry developments to identify new innovation opportunities. Document learnings from experiments (both successes and failures) to strengthen our innovation process. Expected Qualifications & Skills: 2+ years in Product Management, Program Management, Operations, or Business Strategy—preferably in tech, SaaS, or innovation-driven environments. Proven track record of launching products or managing complex initiatives from concept to delivery. Strong execution skills with the ability to multitask, prioritize, and move fast in ambiguous environments. Comfortable making decisions with incomplete information and iterating based on feedback. Excellent communication and collaboration skills—you can work effectively with technical teams, clients, and leadership. Data-informed decision-making mindset with a focus on outcomes and impact. Market research skills and genuine curiosity about AI, healthcare, and emerging technologies. Ability to work independently in a fully remote setup with flexibility across time zones. description: SAVE JOB Technical Officer | Colombo  Location :  Colombo,  Sri Lanka and needed to visit sites in project locations Contract Type  : Long Term Contract  Objective: To support the implementation and supervision of climate-resilient WASH interventions by ensuring technical soundness, timely execution of activities, coordination with stakeholders, and quality assurance of deliverables under the project work plan. Support water quality testing of installed RWHS, facilitate sample collection, and coordinate with relevant laboratories to ensure safe water standards are met. Support Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) activities by collecting field data and providing required documentation to the M&E team. Required Qualification and Skills: Diploma/NCT in Civil Engineering or a related field. Minimum 2–3 years of experience in field-based WASH projects or rural infrastructure development. title: Tax Manager
description: SAVE JOB Tax Manager Responsibilities Responsible for leading all tax operations and strategy for Sri Lanka, ensuring compliance, managing the team, and aligning with AIDC group policies including: Oversee all direct and indirect tax matters, including corporate income tax, VAT, withholding tax, digital service taxes, and transfer pricing. Ensure timely and accurate compliance with all statutory obligations. Manage and mentor the 3-member tax team in Sri Lanka, fostering a positive, collaborative, and high-performing culture while ensuring effective delegation and delivery of all tasks. Maintain strong working relationships with tax authorities at all levels and engage proactively with external tax advisors/consultants to ensure smooth resolution of tax matters, audits, and assessments. Act as the key link between Sri Lanka operations and the Regional Head of Tax & AIDC Tax Director, ensuring timely reporting, escalation of issues, and alignment with AIDC policies and controls. Identify opportunities for tax savings, efficiencies, and risk mitigation, including evaluating tax automation solutions and process improvements. Lead responses to tax audits, assessments, and investigations, ensuring well-documented defenses and compliance with legal requirements. Ensure that all tax processes, filings, and reporting adhere to both local regulations and AIDC group tax policies; implement controls to maintain accuracy and compliance. Stay ahead of tax law changes, budget announcements, and regulatory developments; provide timely guidance to management on implications for the business. Work closely with Finance, Legal, Operations, and other teams to integrate tax considerations into business decisions and ensure smooth operational execution of tax processes. Deliver clear, timely, and accurate reports on all tax matters (compliance status, audits, risks, savings opportunities) to the Regional Head of Tax and AIDC Tax Director. Requirements/Qualifications ACCA (Qualified)/CA(Finalist)/Bachelor's degree and/or professional qualification in Taxation, Accounting, or related fields 5 – 8 years accounting or tax experience in public accounting firm (Big 4 preferred) and/or MNC Willingness to learn and deepen expertise in transfer pricing, corporate income tax, VAT/GST regimes, domestic and international withholding tax, tax compliance, and tax audits. Strong analytical skills with solid knowledge and experiences on accounting/taxation. Self-starter, detail-oriented, resourceful, able to work independently, multitask, and manage tight deadlines. Strong business acumen, with ability to propose practical solutions to tax issues after consulting with internal stakeholders and advisors. Excellent communication skills to collaborate effectively with internal teams and manage external advisors. Pro-active, hands on, enthusiastic and not afraid to ask questions and challenge the status quo. Experience with E-commerce and tax compliance matters would be an advantage, but not a must. PLEASE CLICK THE APPLY BUTTON TO SEND YOUR CV VIA XPRESSJOBS

title: Tax Manager - United Motors Group
description: SAVE JOB United Motors Lanka PLC has been moving people in comfort for over 80 years. As a trusted leader in the automotive industry, we continue to drive new standards of service, innovation, and engineering excellence. With our commitment to growth and customer satisfaction, we are expanding our operations island-wide. To support this expansion, we are seeking passionate, smart, and disciplined individuals who are ready to take on new challenges and grow with us. Join our team today by applying for the following vacancy. Tax Manager - United Motors Group Key Responsibilities: Ensure timely and accurate oversight preparation, filing, and payment of all applicable taxes (CIT, VAT, SSCL, PAYE, etc.) across the Group. Oversee and manage tax audits and inquiries from the Department of Inland Revenue and the Tax Appeal Commission. Physically attend tax audits, assessments, and appeal hearings/meetings as required. Advise management on tax planning strategies and implications for business decisions. Liaise with external tax consultants and legal advisors where necessary. Monitor changes in tax legislation and assess their impact on the Group. Maintain tax records and documentation in compliance with statutory requirements. Support financial reporting with tax-related disclosures (deferred tax, tax provisions, etc.). Coordinate with finance teams of subsidiaries to ensure standardization and accuracy in tax practices. Candidate Profile & Qualifications: A degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field. Professional qualification such as CA Sri Lanka. Minimum 2-5 years of hands-on experience in taxation, preferably in a Group or large corporate setting. In-depth knowledge of Sri Lankan tax laws and Inland Revenue procedures. Strong analytical skills and attention to detail. Excellent communication skills and ability to manage stakeholder relationships. Experience in working with ERP systems and advanced MS Excel skills will be an added advantage. Canvassing in any form will be a disqualification.  An attractive remuneration package in par with industry standards with excellent career development opportunities awaits the right candidate PLEASE CLICK THE APPLY BUTTON TO SEND YOUR CV VIA XPRESSJOBS View Job Ad

title: Sales Engineer
description: SAVE JOB Hayleys Group is amongst Sri Lanka's largest, and most respected diversified conglomerates with a turnover in excess of USD 1 Billion. FENTONS LIMITED Founded in 1919, Hayleys Fentons Limited is one of Sri Lanka's first engineering companies. As the No.1 Solar EPC and MEP contractor in the country, the company has over 100 years of engineering excellence. Its key specialisations include Solar, Wind and Utility Projects, Mobility Solutions, ICT Systems, Electrical and Lighting, Fire Safety, Air Conditioning and Ventilation, Plumbing and Gas, Security and Communication, Audio-Visual Integration, UPS and Battery Backup, Facilities Management, Architectural Drawings and 3D Visualisation, Industrial Accessories Trading and Hydro Solutions. Renowned for innovation and exceptional client service, the company's main aim is to provide sustainable and innovative engineering services for a better life. Sales Engineer A motivated and results-driven Sales Engineer is required to join a dynamic team. This role is ideal for a technically competent professional with a solid understanding of electrical panel boards and a strong passion for sales and customer engagement. The position plays a key part in driving business growth by promoting high-quality electrical panel solutions, developing new customer relationships, and delivering value-driven technical and commercial solutions to clients across various industries Job Responsibilities Promote and sell electrical panel boards (including LT/HT panels, PCCs, MCCs, distribution boards, etc.). Identify new business opportunities and develop new clients. Manage and grow relationships with existing customers, consultants, and contractors. Prepare technical and commercial proposals, quotations, and tenders. Coordinate with design, production, and project teams to ensure customer requirements are met. Conduct site visits, product presentations, and technical discussions. Achieve sales targets and provide regular sales reports and market feedback. Candidate Profile Bachelor's degree or Diploma in Electrical Engineering (or a related field). Two to five years of experience in panel board or electrical equipment sales. Strong understanding of electrical drawings, specifications, and standards.  Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills. Ability to work independently and handle multiple projects. Willingness to travel for client meetings and site visits. PLEASE CLICK THE APPLY BUTTON TO SEND YOUR DETAILS VIA XPRESSJOBS View Job Ad

title: Technical Manager - Microbiology
description: SAVE JOB Technical Manager - Microbiology Essential Functions: Inspects the laboratory for cleanliness, tidiness, disinfection and disposal of waste Institutes and enforces measures to prevent cross infection, chemical-electrical- fire hazards, wastage, pilferage, losses, damages and abuses Ensure compliance to institutional safety standards and maintenance of MSDS for all chemicals Allocates SMLT’s, MLT’s and laborers to sections of the laboratory Prepares duty rosters of MLT’s and laboratory workers for periodic internal rotation and arrange emergency duty Allocates staff when rostered staff is on leave or when the section is understaffed Maintains Lab Sectional Stores by ordering from the Main Stores: chemicals, stationery, laboratory ware, general items and equipment according to the reorder level and reorder quantity Maintains registers, inventories, ledgers, order book and document files (Staff movement register, food order book, etc.) Conducts verifications of inventoried items annually Ensures that all laboratory equipment and apparatus are in working order and supervises technical operations in the Microbiology Department Obtains the services of Bio Medical Engineers to install service and repair machines and supervises daily maintenance, scheduled maintenance and calibration of equipment Prepares, applies and updates standard operation procedures Develops and maintains Internal and External quality control schemes Assists the Visiting Consultant with respect to reporting and improving quality Ensures the ISO 15189 and JCI Standard is adhered to Prepares outgoing correspondence, responding to incoming correspondence Authorizes disposal of unusable items, to appropriate locations following the relevant procedures Checks and inhibits any unauthorized uses of laboratory Ensures that all the processes and procedures pertaining to all laboratory related matters and aspects are in effect Assessing of the staff skill level, Gap analysis and conducts training and education programs of MLT’s and other laboratory staff Promotes improvement of the medical laboratory technologist profession Critical value reporting within the time frame Ensure accuracy in Specimen collection, transportation, storage and rejection as specified in Institutional policies Preparation and submission of quality reports (antibiotic sensitivity analysis) when an as requested Requirements Should possess - SLMC registration. Science based degree or recognized Diploma in medical laboratory technology. More than 15 years experience in clinical micro-biology with exposure to mycology, virology and TB culture etc. More than 5 years experience as an in-charge of a microbiology laboratory. Special capacity for teaching, guiding the staff with leadership qualities. Key Results Areas: Decrease in customer complaints Increased efficiency in patient care with quality and safety Decrease in costs Increase in number of repeat patrons Increase in number of new patrons Maintaining ISO Standards PLEASE CLICK THE APPLY BUTTON TO SEND YOUR CV VIA XPRESSJOBS

Excellent communication and negotiation skills in English and Sinhala/Tamil. Proven ability to build networks, manage relationships, and achieve recruitment targets. A proactive, self-motivated individual with a passion for global education. title: Sales Executives
description:
Job Description This position offers a challenging yet rewarding career as Sales Executives of Wycherley International, with placements in Colombo as well as at our branches in Dehiwala and Gampaha. Selected candidates will be responsible for promoting educational programs, building client relationships and conducting presentations and informative sessions for prospective students and their parents to achieve sales objectives of the organization. Excellent career prospects await the right candidates. Qualifications / Skills A minimum of three years' Sales experience with a proven track record, preferably in an education-related organization or at least in a service organization will give you a distinct edge. A sound educational background with full / part qualifications in Marketing or another recognized professional discipline will be an advantage. High level of customer orientation and a passion for helping students Ability to work in a target-driven environment Strong interpersonal and communication skills Remuneration The successful candidates will be provided with an attractive remuneration package, including performance-based incentives and other related perks that are above industry standards. PLEASE CLICK THE APPLY BUTTON TO SEND YOUR CV VIA XPRESSJOBS Wycherley International School, 5th floor, 'Ceylinco House', 69, Janadhipathi Mawatha, Colombo 1. View Job Ad APPLY FOR JOB SAVE JOB Unemployment in Sri Lanka is estimated to be over 390,816, Share this job and help another! Sales Executives | Colombo / Dehiwala / Gampaha  Wycherley International School (Pvt) Ltd Colombo, Gampaha 12  days left Full Time Summary A minimum of three years' Sales experience with a proven track record, preferably in an education-related organization or at least in a service organization will give you a distinct edge. Please refer to the job advert for further information. Education Relevant Qualification  Experience 03 years   Salary Range Any APPLY FOR JOB SAVE JOB Education / Higher Education  ( 278 ) Sales / Marketing / New Business Development  ( 1544 ) Business Management  ( 1544 ) Wycherley International School (Pvt) Ltd 1  Job Post Colombo No. 232, Bauddhaloka Mw, Colombo 07, Sri Lanka. Wycherley is built on an Edifice of great values.
The mention of the name “Wycherley” rings many nostalgic memories far and wide. Wycherley International School was founded on January 7th 1985. It was a time when everybody felt the need to get back into a good system of English Education. The location was that of Dr. R . L Spittel’s “Wycherley Nursing Home” at 232, Bauddhaloka Mawatha, Colombo 7. Hence the Management decided to retain the name” Wycherley” for the school too.

On the 7th January 1985 the school commenced operation with just around one hundred students and an Academic and Office Staff of about forty. Initially the classes that set the school on the map of the Country’s Educational System, were only from the Nursery up to Grade 8.

Simplicity has always been the tradition at Wycherley. The very first day of establishment was signalled only with the lighting of the traditional oil lamp.
In September 1986 when the new Academic Year commenced, the School too showed signs of growing. The classes were now stretched up to Grade 12 so much so, that as it touched its first anniversary, the number on roll shot up to 450 students, which naturally entailed an increase in the Staff Cadre.

As numbers kept growing, in September 1988 Grade 9 to 12 were moved over to the location at No. 5, Queens Road, Colombo 3. This move created greater space and scope for the development of the Junior School and the High School.
The Junior School saw its growth in the setting up of two parallel classes for each Grade. The High School set up Laboratories, one for Chemistry and Physics and the other for Botany / Zoology/ Biology and Human Biology. Libraries were set up at both sections of the school.
By the end of 1988, the numbers had soared to 800 students. This necessitated the setting up of three parallel classes for each Grade.
The Foundation of Wycherley is built on Tradition, Simplicity and Discipline. “Success through discipline” is what Wycherley always aims at. The Principal has always had a vision to make Wycherley a truly “National School” illustrative of the Global Village Concept.
When Wycherley reached the ten year milestone in 1996, the population touched a thousand. The name of Wycherley has always been kept shining with excellent London Ordinary Level and London Advanced Level Examination results. Wycherley follows the Cambridge System of Examinations based on the British Educational System.

When the world heralded the “New Millennium” in 2001, Wycherley had reached its fifteenth anniversary. The school has forged ahead with a concept of racial and religious harmony which is cemented by a common medium of instruction- English. Recently a Don at Cambridge remarked “We need more students from Wycherley” and that speaks volumes for this hallowed institution.
The School has now come under the umbrella of a new management. The many changes in the infrastructure, modifications of the school and the greater thrust into the Cambridge System of Curriculum from the Primary Level onwards, opens new vistas for the students as they progress, heading towards higher education. The students will have choices of entry into foreign Universities and diverse fields of specialisation.
Wycherley is committed to making a better and brighter future for children who are in her hands. With DISCIPLINE, TRADITION and a CULTURALLY NURTURED International School, the students will go into the World to build a well chiselled and disciplined society. 1 2 3 4 5 6 7

title: Sales Manager - Luxury Real Estate
description: SAVE JOB Sales Manager -  Luxury Real Estate About Us AKARA is a leading real estate agency specializing in luxury apartments in Colombo. We are committed to delivering exceptional service and results for our clients. With a talented sales team and a growing brand, we are now seeking a dynamic and experienced Sales Manager to mentor our agents, improve their skills, and ensure every lead is handled effectively. Role Overview We are looking for an experienced, team-focused Sales Manager with a proven track record in managing and developing high-performing sales teams. This role is not about doing sales personally — it’s about coaching, guiding, and ensuring the team consistently converts opportunities into closed deals. Key Responsibilities 1. Team Leadership & Mentoring Lead and manage a team of real estate agents, ensuring they meet and exceed performance targets. Provide one-on-one coaching to help agents improve their negotiation, communication, and closing skills. Identify skill gaps and provide continuous training and support. 2. Lead Management & Conversion Ensure every lead is followed up promptly and handled professionally from start to finish. Monitor lead pipelines in the CRM (Zoho) and make sure no opportunities are lost due to poor follow-up. Assign leads effectively to match agent strengths with client needs. 3. Sales Process Improvement Audit and refine the sales process to maximize conversion rates. Implement best practices for lead handling, client follow-up, and appointment management. Provide weekly reports on team performance, highlighting wins and areas for improvement. 4. Performance Monitoring & Accountability Track and monitor KPIs such as: Lead-to-appointment ratio Appointment-to-deal ratio Lead response time 5. Collaboration with Management Work closely with the Operations Manager to align sales processes with business goals. Share market insights, team feedback, and performance trends with management. Requirements Proven experience as a Sales Manager, Team Leader, or similar role. Strong background in mentoring and developing junior sales talent. Excellent knowledge of sales processes and CRM systems (Zoho preferred). Exceptional communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills. Ability to inspire, motivate, and drive a team to achieve results. Real estate experience is an advantage but not mandatory. Preferred Qualities People-first leadership style approachable yet firm when needed. Hands-on mentor who leads by example and invests in the growth of their team. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Analytical thinker who uses data to make decisions. What We Offer Competitive salary + performance incentives based on team success. Opportunity to lead in a fast-paced, high-growth environment. Supportive management with a long-term vision. Continuous learning and career development opportunities. title: Sales Representative (Male/Female)

title: Sales Representative (Mobil Lubricants )
description: SAVE JOB අලෙවි නියෝජිතයින් (මොබිල් ලිහිසි තෙල්) | නැගෙනහිර / දකුණු පළාත අපගේ කණ්ඩායමට එක්වීම සඳහා ලිහිසි තෙල් විකිණීමට කැමති පළපුරුදු අලෙවිකරුවෙකු අපි සොයමින් සිටිමු. මෙම භූමිකාව අපගේ සංවිධානයේ නිශ්චිත ක්ෂේත්‍රයක විකුණුම් මෙහෙයවීම සඳහා වගකිව යුතුය. ඔබට ශක්තිමත් විකුණුම් පසුබිමක් සහ විකුණුම් කෙරෙහි ආශාවක් තිබේ නම් මෙය ඔබට හොඳ අවස්ථාවක්. ප්‍රධාන වගකීම් ලිහිසි තෙල් අලෙවි කිරීම සඳහා සිල්ලර වෙළඳසැල්, තෙල් වෙළඳසැල්, බෝට්ටු නිෂ්පාදකයින්, මාළු ආම්පන්න උපකරණ අලෙවිසැල් වෙත යාම කළමනාකරණය විසින් ලබා දී ඇති මාසික විකුණුම් ඉලක්ක සපුරා ගැනීම පවතින ගනුදෙනුකරුවන් සමඟ ශක්තිමත් සබඳතා පවත්වා ගැනීමට සහ නව මඟ පෙන්වීම් ජනනය කිරීමට නිතිපතා ක්ෂේත්‍ර චාරිකා පැවැත්වීම අනාගත ගනුදෙනුකරුවන් සමඟ සෞඛ්‍ය සම්පන්න විකුණුම් නල මාර්ගයක් ගොඩනැගීම සහ කළමනාකරණය කිරීම. පාරිභෝගික ණයගැතියන් සමඟ පසු විපරම් කිරීම සහ කාලෝචිත ලෙස මුදල් ගෙවීම සහතික කිරීම. නිපුණතා සහ පළපුරුද්ද අවශ්‍ය වේ ඕනෑම කර්මාන්තයක සිල්ලර විකුණුම්වල ඔප්පු කළ අත්දැකීම්. (ලිහිසි තෙල් කර්මාන්තය අමතර වාසියක් වනු ඇත) සේවාදායකයින් සමඟ විශ්වාසය ගොඩනැගීම සඳහා විශිෂ්ට සන්නිවේදන කුසලතා. (සිංහල සහ දෙමළ) වලංගු යතුරුපැදි බලපත්‍රයක් අවශ්‍ය වේ. තෝරාගත් අපේක්ෂකයාට කාර්ය සාධනය මත පදනම් වූ දිරිගැන්වීම් සහිත ආකර්ශනීය වැටුප් පැකේජයක් ලැබෙනු ඇත. සාර්ථක අපේක්ෂකයාට කර්මාන්ත ප්‍රමිතීන්ට සහ අනෙකුත් අමතර ප්‍රතිලාභවලට සමාන තරඟකාරී වැටුප් පැකේජයක් ලබා දෙනු ඇත XpressJobs හරහා ඔබේ CV යැවීමට කරුණාකර අයදුම් කිරීමේ බොත්තම ක්ලික් කරන්න. விற்பனை பிரதிநிதி (மொபில் லூப்ரிகன்ட்ஸ்) | கிழக்கு / தெற்கு மாகாணம் இலங்கையில் 75 ஆண்டுகளுக்கு மேற்பட்ட தொழில் தலைமைத்துவத்தை கொண்ட புகழ்பெற்ற குழுமம் கடல் & லாஜிஸ்டிக்ஸ், பெட்ரோலியம் & எரிசக்தி, உற்பத்தி & விநியோகம், சொத்துக்கள் & மூலதன முதலீடுகள், மற்றும் ஓய்வு (Leisure) ஆகிய ஐந்து முக்கிய துறைகளில் வலுவான நிலைப்பாட்டுடன் செயல்படுகிறது. மெக்லாரன்ஸ் (McLarens) இலங்கையில் சிறந்த சர்வதேச பிராண்டுகளை (Fortune 500 உட்பட) பிரதிநிதித்துவப்படுத்தும் சிறப்புக் குரலாக திகழ்கிறது. நீங்கள் எங்கள் வெற்றியை முன்னெடுத்து செல்லும் ஆயிரத்துக்கும் மேற்பட்ட அர்ப்பணிப்புடன் பணிபுரியும் தொழில்முனைவோரின் குழுவின் ஒரு பகுதியாக இருப்பீர்கள். மெக்லாரன்ஸில், நாங்கள் வளர்ச்சிக்கு முன்னுரிமை அளித்து, எங்கள் பணியாளர்களில் தொடர்ச்சியான முதலீடு செய்து, புதுமை மற்றும் ஒத்துழைப்பை ஊக்குவிக்கும் சுறுசுறுப்பான பண்பாட்டை வளர்க்கிறோம். எங்கள் குழுவுடன் சேர்ந்து லூப்ரிகன்ட்ஸ் (lubricants) விற்பனை செய்யும் அனுபவமிக்க விற்பனையாளர் ஒருவரை நாங்கள் தேடுகிறோம். இந்த பணி குறிப்பிட்ட பகுதியிலுள்ள விற்பனையை முன்னெடுத்து செல்வதற்கான பொறுப்பை வகிக்கும். நீங்கள் விற்பனை அனுபவமும் விற்பனையில் ஆர்வமும் கொண்டவராக இருந்தால், இது உங்களுக்கான சிறந்த வாய்ப்பாகும். முக்கிய பொறுப்புகள் சில்லறை கடைகள், எண்ணெய் மார்ட்கள், படகு உற்பத்தியாளர்கள், மீன்பிடி உபகரணக் கடைகள் ஆகியவற்றைச் சந்தித்து லூப்ரிகன்ட்ஸ் விற்பனை செய்தல். மேலாண்மை வழங்கும் மாதாந்திர விற்பனை இலக்குகளை அடைவது. தற்போது உள்ள வாடிக்கையாளர்களுடன் வலுவான உறவுகளை பேணுவதற்கும் புதிய வாடிக்கையாளர்களை உருவாக்குவதற்கும் வழக்கமான களப் பயணங்கள் மேற்கொள்ளல். புதிய வாடிக்கையாளர்களுடன் விற்பனை வாய்ப்புகளை உருவாக்கி பராமரித்தல். வாடிக்கையாளர்களின் நிலுவைத் தொகைகளை பின்தொடர்ந்து சரியான நேரத்தில் வசூல் செய்ய உறுதி செய்தல். தேவையான திறன்கள் மற்றும் அனுபவம் எந்தத் துறையிலும் சில்லறை விற்பனை அனுபவம் அவசியம். (லூப்ரிகன்ட் துறையில் அனுபவம் கூடுதல் நன்மையாகும்.) வாடிக்கையாளர்களுடன் நம்பிக்கை உறவை உருவாக்க சிறந்த தொடர்பாடல் திறன். (சிங்களம் மற்றும் தமிழ் மொழிகளில்) செல்லுபடியாகும் மோட்டார் சைக்கிள் உரிமம் அவசியம். ஊதியம் தேர்ந்தெடுக்கப்படும் விண்ணப்பதாரருக்கு செயல்திறன் அடிப்படையிலான ஊக்கத்தொகையுடன் கூடிய கவர்ச்சிகரமான ஊதிய தொகுப்பு வழங்கப்படும். துறையின் தரநிலைகளுக்கு இணையான போட்டித்திறனுள்ள ஊதியம் மற்றும் பிற நன்மைகளும் வழங்கப்படும். title: වෙළඳ නියෝජිත ( පිරිමි) - Sales Representative (Male)

title: Sales Representative (Male)
description: SAVE JOB Sales Representative (Male) | Avissawella  Lakmo specializes in the importation and distribution of premium-quality electrical products, livestock equipment, and evaporative cooling systems tailored for use in factories, warehouses, and livestock operations. title: Online Reputation Management Associate - (Ops) I Work from Home
description: SAVE JOB Online Reputation Management Associate - (Ops) I Work from Home We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Online Reputation Management Associate to manage and enhance the online presence of our international healthcare clients. This role focuses on optimizing client profiles, monitoring reviews, implementing reputation-building strategies, and maintaining positive digital interactions. The ideal candidate is highly organized, tech-savvy, and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment while adhering to best practices in online reputation management. Key Responsibilities: Primary Coordinator for Online Reputation Services: Serve as the primary coordinator for all online reputation management tasks for assigned client accounts. Profile Creation & Management: Establish and manage client profiles on platforms such as Google, Yelp, Healthgrades, and other relevant review sites. Reputation Optimization: Ensure all client profiles are optimized for maximum visibility, accuracy, and positive reputation. Identify opportunities for improvement and implement strategies to enhance client online presence. Review Monitoring & Response: Monitor incoming reviews and feedback, drafting appropriate, professional responses to maintain a positive online reputation. Client Account Management Coordination: Act as the main point of contact between client account managers and internal backend teams for all reputation management–related tasks, ensuring smooth execution and alignment with client objectives. Review Generation Strategy: Develop strategies to encourage clients to obtain fresh, positive reviews regularly, such as feedback solicitation or customer engagement campaigns. Analysis & Reporting: Track and analyze metrics to evaluate clients’ online reputation, provide actionable insights, and recommend improvements. Client Engagement & Meetings: Attend and actively participate in voice and video meetings (Zoom/VOIP) with international clients, often during EST time zones, to discuss strategies, address concerns, and provide updates. Required Skills and Qualifications: Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English. Experience managing social media or online profiles. Diploma in Marketing or a related field. Knowledge of digital marketing tools and techniques. Strong computer literacy, including experience with Skype, Zoom, and G Suite. Excellent organizational and time-management skills. Self-motivated with a proactive, problem-solving mindset. Ability to perform effectively in a high-demand, fast-paced work environment. Tech-savvy and adaptable to new software or tools. Preferred / Nice-to-Have Skills: Prior experience in a marketing or reputation management role. Experience creating graphics using web-based platforms like Canva. Work Hours and Requirements: Daily Work: 8 hours per day, with at least 3 hours worked at night (6:30 PM – 12:00 AM). Flexibility to work extra hours or weekends as required for high-priority tasks or events. Maintain respectful communication with colleagues, managers, and clients. Adherence to company policies, confidentiality guidelines, and employment contract provisions. Home workspace must be quiet, distraction-free, with reliable internet and necessary hardware/software. Benefits: 100% Remote Work with flexible working hours within defined ranges. Monthly remuneration starting from LKR 80,000 (inclusive of basic salary and fixed allowances) Opportunity to work with international clients and gain global marketing experience. Exposure to professional development, training, and certification programs. Performance-based rewards and career growth opportunities. Join a diverse team of 250+ professionals across Sri Lanka, Pakistan, Malaysia, the US, and Canada. About Bizycorp & Ekwa Marketing: Learn about Bizycorp – a trusted company providing remote work opportunities since 2010. Leadership Team – meet the leaders guiding our growth. Team Success Stories – hear from our members around the globe. Ekwa Marketing – supporting healthcare professionals in dominating digital marketing, social media, and search results. Equal Opportunity Employer: Bizycorp celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment.  All qualified candidates will be considered regardless of race, religion, gender, or disability status. PLEASE CLICK THE APPLY BUTTON TO SEND YOUR CV VIA XPRESSJOBS

title: E-commerce Executive - Multi vendor Platforms
description: SAVE JOB E-commerce Executive - Multi vendor Platforms ABOUT US: At KTI Private Limited, we specialize in providing top-quality mother and baby care products through both physical and online sales channels. We are currently expanding our presence across multivendor ecommerce platforms like Daraz, Kapruka, and others, and are looking for a dynamic Ecommerce Executive to join our team! JOB OVERVIEW: We are seeking an experienced Ecommerce Executive to manage and drive sales across various multivendor ecommerce platforms. You will be responsible for optimizing product listings, han- dling promotions, managing customer inquiries, and ensuring smooth operational processes to meet and exceed sales targets. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Manage and optimize product listings on platforms like Daraz and Kapruka. Track sales performance and analyze data to identify growth opportunities. Plan and execute promotions to boost sales and product visibility. Oversee order processing and ensure timely delivery. Respond to customer inquiries and resolve any issues. Collaborate with platform account managers to maximize sales potential. Monitor inventory levels and ensure timely restocking. Prepare sales reports and provide insights for continuous improvement. Stay updated with platform policies and features. Coordinate with internal teams to support sales and marketing efforts. QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field. Proven experience in managing ecommerce platforms (preferably Daraz, Kapruka, or similar). Strong understanding of online sales strategies, product listings, and ecommerce best practices. Excellent communication and customer service skills. Analytical mindset with experience in using data to drive decision-making. Proficiency in using Microsoft Excel and ecommerce management tools. Ability to multitask, work under pressure, and meet deadlines. Knowledge of digital marketing is a plus. PLEASE CLICK THE APPLY BUTTON TO SEND YOUR CV VIA XPRESSJOBS View Job Ad

title: Newsletter Reviewer Cum Editor - (Ops)
company: Work from Home Bizycorp (Private) Ltd Work From Home
description: SAVE JOB Newsletter Reviewer Cum Editor - (Ops) I Work from Home We are seeking detail-oriented, organized, and quality-focused Newsletter Reviewer Cum Editors to support Bizycorp’s email marketing operations. This role is responsible for reviewing, editing, and coordinating newsletter content to ensure high standards of accuracy, clarity, and consistency across all client communications. As a Newsletter Reviewer Cum Editor, you will work closely with Email Marketing Client Coordinators, designers, and client account managers to ensure newsletters and e-blasts meet client expectations, align with email marketing goals, and are delivered on time. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Ensure that all newsletters and e-blasts are free from spelling, grammar, punctuation, and formatting errors before approval or deployment. Review newsletter content to ensure clarity, consistency, and alignment with client preferences and email marketing objectives. Collaborate closely with Email Marketing Client Coordinators and designers to meet client expectations related to email design, creativity, and overall quality. Create newsletter sketches or layouts for designers when required. Handle tickets and coordinate with internal backend teams to ensure newsletter-related tasks are completed accurately. Review newsletters based on specific client preferences and guidelines provided internally. Ensure content teams complete assigned newsletter write-ups and content deliverables within agreed deadlines. Provide clear and constructive feedback to internal teams to improve content quality and accuracy.   SKILLS, QUALIFICATIONS, AND EXPERIENCE: Good written and spoken English communication skills are required. Strong attention to detail with a keen eye for identifying errors in newsletters and e-blasts. Ability to review content thoroughly and maintain consistent quality standards. Prior experience in newsletter reviewing, editing, content quality control, or a similar role is an added advantage. Prior experience working with newsletters is mandatory. Candidates must be comfortable communicating with foreign clients via Zoom when required. WORK HOURS AND REQUIREMENTS: You must work 8 hours per day, 40 hours per week (Monday to Friday). 4 hours must be worked between 6:30 PM and 1:30 AM Sri Lanka Standard Time. title: Business Development Executive
description: SAVE JOB Business Development Executive Company Overview OH Productions is a creative powerhouse specializing in high-impact video production and digital storytelling. Role Objective Your primary goal is to grow OH Productions' portfolio by securing video production and social media management projects. You will focus on building high-value partnerships with hotels, restaurants, and corporate companies, helping them elevate their brand through professional visual content. Brand Advocacy: Represent OH Productions at industry events, networking mixers, and corporate gatherings to build a strong presence in the local market. Strategic Planning: Collaborate with the creative team to develop "pitch decks" that showcase our ability to solve specific marketing problems for hotels and corporates. Industry Knowledge: A solid understanding of social media trends (Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn) and the value of video marketing. Communication: Exceptional English communication and presentation skills. Ability to speak Sinhala/Tamil is highly preferred for local client relations. Professionalism: Ability to interact confidently with high-level corporate executives and hotel management. Work Environment This is an on-site and field-active role. While you will have a base at our office, you will spend a significant portion of your time "on the ground"—visiting potential clients at their locations (hotels/restaurants) to build relationships and assess their production needs. What We Offer A creative and fast-paced work environment. Opportunity to work with some of the most exciting brands in the hospitality and corporate sectors. Passion for Wellness: A strong interest in health and wellness trends. WHAT YOU'LL ENJOY Competitive salary with performance-based rewards. Job Description Manage and execute user incentive programs to drive user engagement and retention in the Sri Lanka market. title: Project Management Associate
company: Work From Home Bizycorp (Private) Ltd Work From Home
description: SAVE JOB Project Management Associate | Work From Home The Project Management Associate will support the Product Management team through structured research, feasibility assessments, and end-to-end project execution. This is a full-time role intended for candidates who can work independently, think through ambiguity, and take ownership of assigned projects from start to finish. It is  not a coordination-only or trainee role . Candidates are expected to contribute with minimal supervision after onboarding. Job Responsibilities: 1) Research & feasibility Conduct structured research and feasibility assessments for product or operations initiatives Evaluate ideas using defined criteria and frameworks Produce clear feasibility outputs with assumptions, risks, dependencies, and recommendations 2) Execution (idea → pilot → launch) Translate ambiguous inputs into requirements, scope, and step-by-step execution plans Coordinate pilots, track outcomes and metrics, and summarize learnings Support launch and post-launch optimization where relevant Keep work moving end-to-end, escalating risks early with proposed options 3) Documentation & systems Produce and maintain high-quality documentation: research briefs, feasibility reports, SOPs, templates, decision logs Keep project tools updated (ClickUp/Asana/Monday or similar) and maintain status visibility for stakeholders You’ll Thrive in this Role if You: Prefer ownership and execution, and accountability Can work with incomplete information and move forward responsibly Write clearly and enjoy turning messy problems into structured plans and documentation Can manage multiple priorities and make smart tradeoffs Are comfortable receiving feedback and iterating quickly Are looking for a  full-time, long-term, remote role   Expected Qualifications & Skills Required: 2–3 years experience in roles involving execution + analysis (product ops, delivery/project execution, business analysis, operations, research-heavy coordination, customer enablement, etc.) Strong written communication (briefs, reports, SOPs) Strong organization and follow-through Familiarity with project management tools (e.g., ClickUp, Asana, Monday.com, or similar).          Preferred: Experience in service-based environments (digital marketing, healthcare services, SaaS) Prior remote work experience Experience supporting process improvement, research initiatives, or operational documentation       Work Hours & Expectations Because we support U.S.-based clients and teams, this role requires daily overlap across two windows: 4 hours during Sri Lanka daytime 4 hours during Sri Lanka nighttime These overlap windows are a core requirement. You’ll still have flexibility in how you structure your schedule, but the overlap coverage must be met.  Occasionally, important meetings or time-sensitive tasks may require additional availability. This is a full-time role that requires a commitment of 8 working hours per day, Monday through Friday. This role requires a high level of professionalism, accountability, and follow-through, including attending required meetings and meeting assigned deadlines. You will be expected to comply with company policies and contractual obligations, including maintaining strict confidentiality of product and client information.         Benefits Work-from-Home: Enjoy the convenience of remote work. EPF/ETF: Enrollment in Sri Lanka’s employee provident and trust funds. Legal Compliance: Adherence to the Sri Lankan Shop and Office Act. Salary: Starting at  80,000 LKR  (including basic Salary and Fixed allowances), with a potential increment after a 6-month probation. Additional Perks include: Paid leave, selected training/certification programs, and performance-based annual rewards. Global Exposure: Work with international clients and a diverse team of 250+ employees worldwide.   We do not offer part-time roles, so we only apply if you are serious about committing your full-time commitment to our company.
